He rails against “scum” reporters, withholding credentials from major news organizations and lashing out on Twitter this week against the “failing New York Times,” while granting lengthy interviews to those same outlets and basking in their attention.

But Donald Trump’s choice this week of a renegade, far-right news executive to lead his campaign was an inevitable culmination of a candidate’s war with the mainstream media and his embrace of his party’s most incendiary voices.
He exploits the divide in conservative media to bash enemies and create safe zones on select television and radio shows.
He questions the core tenets of the 1st Amendment and flouts the judgment of fact-checkers with abandon.
Trump’s obsession with the media has been one of the few constants in his campaign.
